definition: lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long
to live/alive/living/work/workmanship
tiger/CL:隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: The lads work with furious energy.
sentences.chinese: 小伙子干起活来真是生龙活虎。

sentences.english: Like tigers the fighters continued up the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 战士们还是生龙活虎地往悬岩上爬。
这种自由能让你生龙活虎。

sentences.english: And on the last sighting, capitalism appeared as feisty asever.
sentences.chinese: 而再看最后一眼，资本主义似乎和原来一样生龙活虎。

sentences.english: The teenagers will thrive on teachers' guidance with full of vim and vigor.
sentences.chinese: 茁壮成长的青少年将在教师的指导与生龙活虎。

definition: to leap and frisk about (idiom); lively/healthy and active
spirit trembling with excitement (idiom); in high spirits/lively and full of enthusiasm/full of energy/con brio
in great spirits/to have great vitality
in glowing spirits (idiom); bursting with life/radiating health and vigor
full of vigor (idiom)/lively/in high spirits
in high spirits (idiom); glowing with health and vigor
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
lit. vitality a hundredfold (idiom); refreshed/one's vigor thoroughly restored
vigorous/energetic
having high fighting spirit
to have only a breath of life (idiom)
arrogant appearance/smug appearance/to act condescending/to put on airs
dying/at one's last gasp
glowing with health and vivacity (idiom)
to rouse/to invigorate/to enliven/to put sb into high spirits/con brio
half dead/more dead than alive
